snippet: Mr. Hodgson, appointed by President Richard M. Nixon, promoted construction jobs for minority workers and safer American workplaces.
abstract: James D Hodgson, President Richard M Nixon's secretary of labor and later ambassador to Japan in the Ford administration, dies at 96.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Hodgson, appointed by President Richard M. Nixon, promoted construction jobs for minority workers and safer American workplaces.

headline.seo: James D. Hodgson, Labor Secretary, Dies at 96
headline.main: James D. Hodgson,  Labor Secretary and Ambassador, Dies at 96
headline.print_headline: James D. Hodgson, 96, Labor Secretary and Ambassador
